Cuerpo: Date: Tue, 26 Nov 1996 00:13:23 GMT Server: NCSA/1.4.2 Content-type: text/html Last-modified: Mon, 18 Nov 1996 10:51:57 GMT Content-length: 1829 Reinhard von Hanxleden's Home Page Reinhard von Hanxleden Reinhard v. Hanxleden received his Vordiplom in computer science/physics from Christian Albrechts University in Kiel, Germany, in 1987 and his M.S. in computer science from Pennsylvania State University in 1989. In 1995, he received his Ph.D. in computer science from Rice University. Since January 1995 he is a Research Associate at Daimler Benz AG in Berlin. His research interests include data parallel compilers for irregular problems, hardware/software codesign, and high performance hubcaps. For contact info, finger reinhard<at>cs.rice.edu. [In his quest for cutting down electronic junk mail, Reinhard v. Hanxleden hopes that whatever search engine is crawling the domain for email addresses for whatever purpose is dumb enough to just look for strings containing @-signs.] Dissertation: Compiler Support for Machine-Independent Parallelization of Irregular Problems Selected Publications Affiliations Rice Computer Science Department home page Center for Research on Parallel Computation (CRPC) home page Fortran Tools home page D System home page Rice University home page http://www.cs.rice.edu/~reinhard/
